intro: Cyphostemma pachyrrhachis, commonly known as the thick-stemmed cyphostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, woody stems and is often found in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are usually small and alternate, and it is adapted to survive in dry conditions. Cyphostemma pachyrrhachis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience.
